bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, February 26, 1900

div1.p: Carter writes that he has been delayed en route to Cuba. He gives directions for farm work.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, February 26, 1900
div1.opener:
The Inn
ONE OF THE PLANT SYSTEM HOTELS.
THE
PLANT
SYSTEM
J. H. MURDICK,
MANAGER.
Port Tampa, Fla., Feb 26 1900
Dear Laura:
div1.p:
I did not go last boat either
It was blowing so hard a norther that
instead of leaving at 10 P. M. she lay
at the dock until 7.30 A. M- how.
much longer- I do not know. This would
have put me in Havana- Monday evening
night, & by waiting over I lose only
one day. Also if it was so bad
that the Olivette did not leave
the wharf, the trip would have
been horrible. Now whether it
would have started my head or
no I do not know, but I was afraid
it would. It is fully calm
tonight- a light southerly breeze
& as one norther does not follow
another usually very quickly
I judge the trip will be fair.
The Mars cutter too was 12 hours
late coming in. I am afraid
The Inn
ONE OF THE PLANT SYSTEM HOTELS.
THE
PLANT
SYSTEM
J. H. MURDICK,
MANAGER.
Port Tampa, Fla., ____190
to risk sea-sickness & don't purpose to do
it if avoidable. I am feeling
very well: well enough for any one,
I still have on my double shits &
double drawers & they are fully
comfortable, strange too, because
I was wearing only one at N. R.
The temperature has been about
50 to 60; (45 yesterday morning
havana) & yet it is pleasant with
the th double undergarments.
My next letter will be from
Havana- the bo I sh'd reach that
place Wednesday morning about
6 or 7 A. M. I doubt if I write before
Sunday, as this day accumulates
my work - A letter written
Sunday - leaves Hav.'a Monday
at 1 or 2 P. M. reaches Tampa.
Tuesday night- Jax'lle, Wednes-
day morning & Richmond Thurs-
The Inn
ONE OF THE PLANT SYSTEM HOTELS.
THE
PLANT
SYSTEM
J. H. MURDICK,
MANAGER.
Port Tampa, Fla., ____190
day morning. Whether you get it
Thursday or Friday. is a question
In any case you can count it
4 or 5 days in route, after it
starts, & steamers leave 3 times a
week -- every 2 days twice & then
a hiatus of 3 days. So slow
receipt of letters does not mean
not writing.

Give my love to all & tell
H. to see about grapevines-prune
them the first chance he gets,- & at
his leisure mend the tressles
with wire or strips of board or wood
wood & when the willows put
out next month or in April to
get twigs & tie them out. Also
to drive 3 or 4 stakes by the pear
tree just out side of the gate
going to the Hen house - under - the
Walnut tree, Tell him to
write me about the his geometry
C1
B29
etc, especially send me such
ext original ones as he strikes
as L & himself can not do.

Give my dear love to Mother & to
all- Please write me word that your
dyssepsia has disappeared - advise un-
til I reach Havana.

closer.seg:
P. S. Cut out & send me the text
of the Bill. granting the charter
to the R. R. from R'd to Washington?
